bug.author: mboratko
bug.summary: Lost run: wandb/settings source contains parsing errors
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.13 Python version: 3.7.4 Operating System: Linux
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
When running multiple simultaneous jobs on a cluster it seems as though the wandb/settings file can become corrupted. In particular, I believe the cluster I was working on uses NFS storage, and different wandb processes (on different machines) were trying to read/write to the wandb/settings file at the same time. <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
Created a test file initializing wandb:
<denchmark-code># wandb_test.py import wandb from random import random from time import sleep wandb.init(project="testing-concurrency")
wandb.config.something = 3.1459 for i in range(200): sleep(random()) wandb.log({"epoch": i/10, "loss": 1/i**0.5}) </denchmark-code>
Ran 100 jobs using SLURM.
<denchmark-h:h3>Results</denchmark-h>
99 jobs were logged into the Weights and Biases online interface. When researching why, I found this in the output logs: <denchmark-code>slurm-5468220_30.out:configparser.ParsingError: Source contains parsing errors: '/path/to/file/wandb/settings' </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.83. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Hello mboratko, thank you for reporting this issue!

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mboratko>@mboratko</denchmark-link> I believe this is an issue with the shared filesystem. We're working on a fix, until then you can get around this by adding the following to your wandb.init calls: import tempfile wandb.init(project="testing-concurrency", dir=tempfile.mkdtemp())

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mboratko>@mboratko</denchmark-link>
In the past year we've majorly reworked the CLI and UI for Weights & Biases. We're closing issues older than 6 months. Please comment to reopen.
